Hello!

I'm Cory Streiff, a Berlin-based Product Engineer with over 5 years of experience building scalable digital products that solve real problems and create lasting impact.

I’ve worked across startups, scale-ups, and nonprofits, helping teams design and ship the right technical solutions for the right customers. I love collaborating with designers, developers, and PMs to turn ideas into great products we can all be proud of.

My main stack includes JavaScript/TypeScript (Node.js, React), Ruby, and SQL. I’m currently learning Go, and I’m always open to picking up new tools and frameworks to fit the team and the challenge.

You can reach me at c.streiff@pm.me or let’s connect on LinkedIn.

Background

I graduated from Georgia Institute of Technology (Atlanta, USA) with a degree in Material Science & Engineering. I worked in that field for six years, first at an R&D startup and then at a materials consultancy in New York, working with designers and engineers at Fortune 500 companies.

But after having designed and engineered physical products, I decided to transition to digital products—pursuing a longtime interest in computer science. I then graduated from a 2 year program in Launch School Curriculum and multiple other courses to broaden my tech stack, learn about Product Design and Product Thinking.

I’ve worked with US based companies and nonprofits, German climate start-ups and most recently a Singapore based ed-tech scale up.

At the core, I care about building products that solve real problems—and doing it in close partnership with people who care just as much.

Experience

Sep 2022 - Present

Product Engineer @ KodeKloud

Berlin, Germany

As a Product Engineer on a small, self-organized team, I led the rebuild of a high-traffic Learning Management System (LMS) from the ground up—migrating a legacy WordPress platform with over 600k users to a modern, scalable architecture using Ruby on Rails and React. Working closely with developers, product managers, and customer specialists, I helped shape product direction, proposed architectural decisions, and delivered a reliable platform with seamless third-party integrations, improved performance, and better user experience.

  • Ruby
  • Rails
  • React
  • TypeScript
  • PostgreSQL
  • GCP

May 2022 - Present

Full Stack Software Developer @ Ragnarson

Berlin, Germany

As a Full-Stack Developer in a software house, I worked with a range of clients, including Berlin start-ups, climate tech and SaaS businesses, to build reliable, tested code while playing an active role in shaping the product decisions. I collaborated closely with stakeholders, helping guide technical decisions and ensuring we stayed aligned with the product’s goals.

  • Ruby
  • Rails
  • React
  • TypeScript
  • PostgreSQL
  • GCP

May 2021 - June 2022

Full Stack Developer @ Concrete Jungle

Atlanta, Georga (remotely)

Developed and maintained new features for a web application that enables users to map public, edible trees in Georgia, adding details about the trees and their seasonal availability, helping organize community events to harvest and distribute free food to food-insecure populations.

  • Express

SEO Data Analyst @ BOLD

Warsaw, Poland

Developed scripts in R programming language to analyze web traffic data and guide SEO content generation.

Nov 2015 - Nov 2017

Material Specialist @ Material Connexion

New York City, New York

Provided in-depth materials research on consulting projects for Fortune 500 companies. Consulted with material manufacturers to determine material properties and project suitability.

Jan 2013 - Apr 2015

Materials Engineer @ Verco Materials

Atlanta, Georgia

Optimized spray drying manufacturing process of raw boron carbide to create high density and low porosity parts for armor applicaitons.
